titles.title: Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä mädḫane ʿaläm “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” / Zenahu lä-ṣälbo ḥǝmamu lä-mädḫaninä “Story of our Saviour’s Suffering on the Cross” / Excerpts from the Synaxarion / Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä mädḫane ʿaläm “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” (fols. 3ra-39vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-4vb) I-2) Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” (fols. 4vb-34rb l.12) I-3) Täʾamrä Täklä Maryam “Miracles of Täklä Maryam”: 6 miracles (fols. 34ra l.14-37vb) I-4) About the devotion of Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon to the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (fols. 37vb-39vb) II) Zenahu lä-ṣälbo ḥǝmamu lä-mädḫaninä “Story of our Saviour’s Suffering on the Cross” (fols. 39vb-42ra) III) Excerpts from Synaxarion “Synaxarion” (fols. 42ra-43rb) III-1) Commemorative notice and ʿarke-hymns for the 27th of Mäggabit dedicated to the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ (fol. 42ra-vb) III-2) Commemorative notice and ʿarke-hymn for the 29th of Mäggabit dedicated to the Resurrection of Jesus Christ (fols. 42vb-43rb) IV)Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World” (fols. 43rb-48rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The donor is possibly Gäbrä Mikaʾel (or his family members) mentioned in the concluding supplication formula on fol. 48rb and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 4va, 10rb, 22vb). His family members are mentioned in the concluding supplication formula on fol. 48rb. Elsewhere, Wälättä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ is mentioned (e.g., fols. 12va, 35vb, 39vb). The names have been added in strong crimson ink in a secondary hand.

txstates.txstate: Both boards are broken and repaired with strips of leather. The leather cover is worn and torn off on the edges and on the spine. The original sewing is for the most part missing (remains of the original thread of animal origin are visible between fols. 38v and 39r and in the area of the back board attachment). The Ms. has been crudely resewn and repaired with at least three types of thread: a thread of vegetal origin, a recent synthetic thread and a blue synthetic thread. Many fols. are worn and affected by water.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and repaired) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: single line fillet, double circle, small x, x-form, double crescent with eye, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Tears or small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) — I(8/fols. 3r-10v) — II(8/fols. 11r-18v) — III(8/fols. 19r-26v) — IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) — V(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 35r-42v) — VI(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 43r-49v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling The bottom line is usually written below the ruling (fols. 10rv, 13r-34v, 36r-48r).
The scribe disregarded the ruling in fols. 8rv, 9rv, 11r, 35v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the names of the protagonist; groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines of Texts I-2, I-3, I-4, II-IV; the incipit of the sections of Texts I-2, I-3, I-4 and II; the words sälam “salutation”, sǝbḥat “glory” and a few words on fol. 47rb-47vb in Text IV; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text I is entitled Mäṣḥafä lä-täzkarä mädḫǝn (fol. 3ra l.3-5).

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: Praising prayer to the Trinity and St. Mary.
additional.det: In the note, groups of red lines alternate with groups of black lines. It is partly illegible because the ink has faded away.

extras.extra: - Scribbles, writing exercises (part of Ethiopic syllabary), doodles: fols. 1v, 2rv, 4r, 11r, 13v, 14r, 30r, 34r, 48rv, 49rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings of Texts I-1 and I-2 are indicated by the names of the months (usually rubricated) written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand: ዘታሕሣሥ: fol. 3r ዘጥር: fol. 4va ዘየካቲት: fol. 7ra ዘመጋቢት: fol. 10vb ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 12vb ዘግንቦት: fol. 16ra ዘሰኔ: fol. 18ra ዘሐምሌ: fol. 20ra ዘነሐሴ: fol. 21vb ዘመስከረም: fol. 25ra ዘጥቅምት: fol. 27rb ዘሕዳር: fol. 30vb - Monthly readings of Texts I-3, I-4, II-IV are indicated by the names of the months (usually rubricated) written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand: ዘታሕሣሥ: fol. 34ra ዘጥ[ር]: fol. 34vb ዘየካቲት: fol. 35va ዘመጋቢት: fol. 35vb ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 36va ዘግንቦት: fol. 37ra ዘሰኔ: fol. 37vb ዘሐምሌ: fol. 39ra ዘነሐሴ: fol. 39va ዘመስከረም: fol. 41ra ዘጥቅምት: fol. 42ra ዘኅዳር: fol. 42vb.

miniature.info: Fol. 1v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Legend (added later in a poor hand, partly illegible): ቅዱስ፡ ጊወርገስ፡ <…> “St George”.
Legend (added later in a poor hand): እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ “Mother of Light” ማርያም “Mary”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow) ornamental band; floral motifs, interlaces. Fol. 34rab (incipit of Text I-3): two simple, coloured (red, black) ornamental bands; interlaces.
